snippet: A federal court ruled that the Obama administration was overstepping its authority, and violating the separation of powers in regards to restrictions on lawyers’ access to prisoners at Guantánamo Bay.
abstract: Federal Judge Royce C Lamberth rejects the Obama administration's effort to impose new restrictions on lawyers' access to prisoners at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba, if a prisoner's detention is no longer being actively challenged in federal court; Lamberth hands down scathing opinion, characterizing the government's arguments as untenable and preposterous, and accusing the administration of overstepping its executive power.
lead_paragraph: A federal court ruled that the Obama administration was overstepping its authority, and violating the separation of powers in regards to restrictions on lawyers’ access to prisoners at Guantánamo Bay.

headline.seo: Judge Rejects Limits on Lawyers’ Access to Guantánamo Prisoners
headline.main: Judge Rejects New Rules on Access to Prisoners
headline.print_headline: Judge Rejects New Rules On Access To Prisoners
